Firstly, it violates the rule against ambiguity by stating the time is "either sunrise or sunset." A better approach would be to describe the visible effect, such as "The low sun illuminates the peaks with golden light," without speculating on the cause. Secondly, the caption prioritizes a description of the static landscape over the primary motion, which is the camera's movement. The motion is only mentioned at the end, whereas the instructions state to focus on the subject's motion. The description should be restructured to lead with the action, for example, by starting with "The camera moves steadily forward along a straight road..." Finally, the use of the subjective adjective "majestic" contradicts the instruction to avoid emotional language. The description of the motion itself, "provides a forward-moving perspective as if driving," is also slightly indirect; a more concise and clear description would be to state directly that the camera travels forward at a steady pace down the center of the road.
